titleStmt.title: George W. Montague to James F. Robinson
CWG7822

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Campbellsville Ky
Dec 5th 1862 --
To his Exclency the Governor of Ky
Dr Sir

Benjn C Hord who was regularly elected at the last August election & Commissioned by the Governor to fill the unexpired term of D. B. Moore Justice of the peace in District No 3 Taylor County Ky (resigned, has ^was^ not been qualified (sworn) under his Commission within 30 days after his election, he is therefore recommended for appointment for to fill said unexpired term --
His Commission was misplaced in office & not found until today

Resplly
Geo. W. Montague Clk
Taylor County Court

Taylor Co
J. P.
Dist No. 3
Appd Decr 10 1862
